text: Bag in a box at the Harp - London. Pours a nice, pretty yellow colour. Some honeysuckle in here, moderate pear sweetness, some dry hay stacks. Medium bodied, fine. Sweet finish with faint salty notes, moderate ripe pear. Not bad overall. Enjoyable perry.

Bag in a box at Bristol Beer Festival, 15/3/2014 at 6.1% ABV. Pale gold with next to no carbonation. Enjoyable, tart and slightly sulphurous pear fruit, with a touch of the barnyard and tartish finish. Very good.

Yellow colour with slight haze. Aroma is pear, sweet nectar, some vanilla and mild acidic notes. Flavour is sweet pear, mild red apples, quite acidic with some mild wooden and vanillaish notes. Also some cheesy notes as it gets closer to room temperature. Very pleasant. Good sipper!

Drunk in haste. Pallid yellow looks, no head. Plenty of excellent juicy pear character on show here in the nose and taste. Sweetness not too overpowering. Very drinkable, enjoyed it..
Polypin at Oxford Beer Festival 12-10-07  Poured straw colour with a bit of haze. aroma nice fresh juicy pears, lovely soft ripe pears in the taste regfreshingly tangy, it slipped down a treat.

Comments: A top perry, approachable, yet tasty. A classy drink of soft elegance and candied, juicy flavours.

From barrel @ GBBF 2007, London. Hazy light yellow color with virtually none head. Aroma is pear, light medicine, light sour. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat.
Bag in the box at Planet Thanet BF 07.  Nail varnish aroma.  Stewed pears in mouth.  Very dry on finish.  Excellent dry perry.  Lots of sour/chemical perry on aroma.  Stewed pear fruit in mouth.

A Mes rate: 
Stillage @ Planet Thanet. Pery is not my thing usually. This however was excellent. Dry but not overly so. Sweet and tarty with a glorious pukery juicy feel. Soft yet assertive. Really enjoyed it.
Tap, at GBBF 2005. Hazy straw gold, flat. Soft sweet fruitiness in the nose, some pear sweetness in the mouth and a gentle lingering fruitiness in the finish.

Cask Stillage at the Town Hall, Accrington 21/06/2003
Clear white rich on the palate with a fruity aroma. Lasting finish.

Barrel, GBBF 2005:
Pretty ordinary and acceptable perry. Easy to drink and a bit too watery.

Yes, yes, yes!!!! Another gem from this Welsh producer! Soft lightly sweet pear characters, slight cheesy farmyard characters. Juicy palate, which is perfectly balanced between sweet and tart. This stuff has Silktorks name written all over it!

Top perry of the festival for me - Spicy, intensely fruity bouquet invites you in for a sip.  Hazy yellow golden coloured body.  Fairly sweet flavour is bursting with fresh pears with a lightly sour barnyard undercurrent.  Fairly straight-forward bu very enjoyable.  Medium body is a bit sticky with mild alcohol warming.  Barrel (6.5%) sampled at GBBF 2005.

6.5% according to my notes, but cider and perry does tend to vary from batch to batch. Pale straw colour, with a slight haze and a characteristic perry peachy tinge. This is a pretty decent perry that manages to combine intense fruit and a reasonable amount of traditional character (although perry doesnt tend to develop the depth of barnyard aroma that cider can).  Clean and fresh. Nice, but not the most demanding.
Gravity @ Derby BF. Big on pears to the point of overload; found the aroma to be harsh. Harsh tasting too, very dry, flavours seem to fly by.

Cask conditioned - gravity - Derby BF.  A reasonably clear greenish streaw coloured perry.  The aroma is full of pears and pear skins and is noticeable from a fair distance.   It is quenching, farmyardy and inviting.  The taste is snappy and full of pears.  It is on the dry side.  Clean and juicy with a medium body.  Tasty, moreish and spanking!
